case.summary: Sentencing of the accused for attempted murder. The accused pleaded guilty. The events arose out of a dispute with another prison inmate when the accused was serving another sentence. The accused stabbed the inmate and walked away. The accused had a very difficult life and had lived on the streets and in jail since leaving home at age 14. He had medical issues that required medical attention and treatment. The accused showed no remorse for the offence. HELD: The accused was sentenced to four years' imprisonment. The proper range was between four and six years' imprisonment. The court considered the accused's young age, the fact that this was his first adult sentence, and that he was not beyond redemption.
